docs.lead_paragraph: Managers at one of the nation's premier federal laboratories improperly used taxpayer funds to influence members of Congress and other officials as part of an effort to extend the lab's $2.4 billion management contract, the U.S. Department of Energy's Office of Inspector General said in a report Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chinese and American presidents’ news conference laid bare stubborn differences over issues like press freedom.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Beijing, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong.

docs.snippet: The Chinese and American presidents’ news conference laid bare stubborn differences over issues like press freedom....
docs.abstract: News analysis; Beijing news conference between Pres Xi Jinping and Pres Obama, during which Xi abandons platitudes to warn Western world not to meddle in China's affairs, provides riveting example of why relationship between United States and China remains one of world's most complicated; countries' determination to work together belies deep-rooted historical grievances and fierce rivalry.

headline.main: Fruitful Visit by Obama Ends With a Lecture From Xi
headline.print_headline: Fruitful Visit by Obama Ends With a Lecture From Xi

docs.abstract: Former Pres George W Bush publishes book 41: A Portrait of My Father, unabashed love letter presenting former Pres George H W Bush in heroic terms; Bush says at event marking publication that he wrote book to help nudge along larger historical reassessment of his father's tenure.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping has bold ambitions at home and abroad and sees China as a peer of the United States.
docs.snippet: President Xi Jinping has bold ambitions at home and abroad and sees China as a peer of the United States....
docs.abstract: News analysis; Chinese Pres Xi Jinping, with whom Pres Obama is preparing to meet during tour of Asia, has amassed power faster than any Chinese leader in decades; Xi has emerged as a strongman with bold ambitions at home and abroad who sees China on par with the United States; Xi's rapid rise has disrupted decades in which Chinese Communist Party has made decisions by consensus, and visit with Obama is only latest affirmation of his ascent.

headline.main: Xi Jinping’s Rapid Rise in China Presents Challenges to the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Chinese Leader’s Rapid Rise Presents Challenges to the U.S.
